issue.title: [Python][Filesystem] Expose nanosecond resolution mtime
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6510](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6510). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
FileStats.mtime returns a microsecond resolution datetime object. At some point we should also expose a mtime_ns attribute that gives the exact nanoseconds as an integer, like os.stat does: https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html#pathlib.PurePath.as_posix
